channel.title: Standalone Game Engine
channel.description:
Hello, I was just wondering if it was possible for there to be a "Standalone" Game engine, that provides no method of gameplay, but simply allows you to "test" things in real time. So basically something that simulates server - client communications. HEre let me provide a better description of what I want to do.
I want to make an interface tester, among other things. Not to create new interfaces, but to "explore" the current interfaces. Like a server editor, but built into the client.
It's not very easy for me to explain, but the idea is clear in my mind. I guess I want to make a visual server editor. So like make a visual shop editor, that does not rely on pictures of all the different items and shop screen, but use jage'x own game engine to displaythe interface screen, and then add the items to it in real time.

item.title: Standalone Game Engine
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

No, like completely remove all gameplay functions. Just have cache functions. So like, I won’t be able to walk around, or player rendering or anything like that, but I’ll be able to open interfaces, send frames, stuff like that.

An example would be opening different interfaces, and testing how each works, like the shops interface, bank interface, stuff like that, without actualy playing.

Read full topic

item.title: Standalone Game Engine
item.dc:creator: @Runes_Are_Cool Runes Are Cool?
item.description:
@Runes_Are_Cool wrote:

Just use the same source on a different port if that’s what you mean?

Read full topic
